abstract: Three days after announcing that he was resigning as the head of Google’s Chinese operations, Kai-Fu Lee said he had raised $115 million to create a company that would finance high-tech start-ups in China.
snippet: Three days after announcing that he was resigning as the head of Google’s Chinese operations, Kai-Fu Lee said he had raised $115 million to create a company that would finance high-tech start-ups in China.
lead_paragraph: Three days after announcing that he was resigning as the head of Google’s Chinese operations, Kai-Fu Lee said Monday that he had raised $115 million to create a company that would finance high-tech start-ups in China, The New York Times’s David Barboza reports.

headline.main: Leaving Google China to Back Start-Ups
